2115
2116
#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
2117
2118
unsigned lodepng_zlib_decompress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2119
                                 size_t insize, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings)
2120
6
{
2121
6
  unsigned error = 0;
2122
6
  unsigned CM, CINFO, FDICT;
2123
6
2124
6
  if(insize < 2) return 53; /*error, size of zlib data too small*/
2125
6
  /*read information from zlib header*/
2126
6
  if((in[0] * 256 + in[1]) % 31 != 0)
2127
0
  {
2128
0
    /*error: 256 * in[0] + in[1] must be a multiple of 31, the FCHECK value is supposed to be made that way*/
2129
0
    return 24;
2130
0
  }
2131
6
2132
6
  CM = in[0] & 15;
2133
6
  CINFO = (in[0] >> 4) & 15;
2134
6
  /*FCHECK = in[1] & 31;*/ /*FCHECK is already tested above*/
2135
6
  FDICT = (in[1] >> 5) & 1;
2136
6
  /*FLEVEL = (in[1] >> 6) & 3;*/ /*FLEVEL is not used here*/
2137
6
2138
6
  if(CM != 8 || CINFO > 7)
2139
0
  {
2140
0
    /*error: only compression method 8: inflate with sliding window of 32k is supported by the PNG spec*/
2141
0
    return 25;
2142
0
  }
2143
6
  if(FDICT != 0)
2144
0
  {
2145
0
    /*error: the specification of PNG says about the zlib stream:
2146
0
      "The additional flags shall not specify a preset dictionary."*/
2147
0
    return 26;
2148
0
  }
2149
6
2150
6
  error = inflate(out, outsize, in + 2, insize - 2, settings);
2151
6
  if(error) return error;
2152
6
2153
6
  if(!settings->ignore_adler32)
2154
6
  {
2155
6
    unsigned ADLER32 = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[insize - 4]);
2156
6
    unsigned checksum = adler32(*out, (unsigned)(*outsize));
2157
6
    if(checksum != ADLER32) return 58; /*error, adler checksum not correct, data must be corrupted*/
2158
6
  }
2159
6
2160
6
  return 0; /*no error*/
2161
6
}
2162
2163
static unsigned zlib_decompress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2164
                                size_t insize, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings)
2165
6
{
2166
6
  if(settings->custom_zlib)
2167
0
  {
2168
0
    return settings->custom_zlib(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2169
0
  }
2170
6
  else
2171
6
  {
2172
6
    return lodepng_zlib_decompress(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2173
6
  }
2174
6
}
2175
2176
#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
2177
2178
#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
2179
2180
unsigned lodepng_zlib_compress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2181
                               size_t insize, const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings)
2182
2
{
2183
2
  /*initially, *out must be NULL and outsize 0, if you just give some random *out
2184
2
  that's pointing to a non allocated buffer, this'll crash*/
2185
2
  ucvector outv;
2186
2
  size_t i;
2187
2
  unsigned error;
2188
2
  unsigned char* deflatedata = 0;
2189
2
  size_t deflatesize = 0;
2190
2
2191
2
  /*zlib data: 1 byte CMF (CM+CINFO), 1 byte FLG, deflate data, 4 byte ADLER32 checksum of the Decompressed data*/
2192
2
  unsigned CMF = 120; /*0b01111000: CM 8, CINFO 7. With CINFO 7, any window size up to 32768 can be used.*/
2193
2
  unsigned FLEVEL = 0;
2194
2
  unsigned FDICT = 0;
2195
2
  unsigned CMFFLG = 256 * CMF + FDICT * 32 + FLEVEL * 64;
2196
2
  unsigned FCHECK = 31 - CMFFLG % 31;
2197
2
  CMFFLG += FCHECK;
2198
2
2199
2
  /*ucvector-controlled version of the output buffer, for dynamic array*/
2200
2
  ucvector_init_buffer(&outv, *out, *outsize);
2201
2
2202
2
  ucvector_push_back(&outv, (unsigned char)(CMFFLG >> 8));
2203
2
  ucvector_push_back(&outv, (unsigned char)(CMFFLG & 255));
2204
2
2205
2
  error = deflate(&deflatedata, &deflatesize, in, insize, settings);
2206
2
2207
2
  if(!error)
2208
2
  {
2209
2
    unsigned ADLER32 = adler32(in, (unsigned)insize);
2210
30.4k
    for(i = 0; i != deflatesize; ++i) ucvector_push_back(&outv, deflatedata[i]);
2211
2
    lodepng_free(deflatedata);
2212
2
    lodepng_add32bitInt(&outv, ADLER32);
2213
2
  }
2214
2
2215
2
  *out = outv.data;
2216
2
  *outsize = outv.size;
2217
2
2218
2
  return error;
2219
2
}
2220
2221
/* compress using the default or custom zlib function */
2222
static unsigned zlib_compress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2223
                              size_t insize, const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings)
2224
2
{
2225
2
  if(settings->custom_zlib)
2226
0
  {
2227
0
    return settings->custom_zlib(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2228
0
  }
2229
2
  else
2230
2
  {
2231
2
    return lodepng_zlib_compress(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2232
2
  }
2233
2
}
2234
2235
#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
2236
2237
#else /*no LODEPNG_COMPILE_ZLIB*/
2238
2239
#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
2240
static unsigned zlib_decompress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2241
                                size_t insize, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings)
2242
{
2243
  if(!settings->custom_zlib) return 87; /*no custom zlib function provided */
2244
  return settings->custom_zlib(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2245
}

/*Return the CRC of the bytes buf[0..len-1].*/
2351
unsigned lodepng_crc32(const unsigned char* data, size_t length)
2352
26
{
2353
26
  unsigned r = 0xffffffffu;
2354
26
  size_t i;
2355
91.5k
  for(i = 0; i < length; ++i)
2356
91.5k
  {
2357
91.5k
    r = lodepng_crc32_table[(r ^ data[i]) & 0xff] ^ (r >> 8);
2358
91.5k
  }
2359
26
  return r ^ 0xffffffffu;
2360
26
}

2369
static unsigned char readBitFromReversedStream(size_t* bitpointer, const unsigned char* bitstream)
2370
3.01M
{
2371
3.01M
  unsigned char result = (unsigned char)((bitstream[(*bitpointer) >> 3] >> (7 - ((*bitpointer) & 0x7))) & 1);
2372
3.01M
  ++(*bitpointer);
2373
3.01M
  return result;
2374
3.01M
}
2375
2376
static unsigned readBitsFromReversedStream(size_t* bitpointer, const unsigned char* bitstream, size_t nbits)
2377
1.20M
{
2378
1.20M
  unsigned result = 0;
2379
1.20M
  size_t i;
2380
2.41M
  for(i = 0 ; i < nbits; ++i)
2381
1.20M
  {
2382
1.20M
    result <<= 1;
2383
1.20M
    result |= (unsigned)readBitFromReversedStream(bitpointer, bitstream);
2384
1.20M
  }
2385
1.20M
  return result;
2386
1.20M
}

static void setBitOfReversedStream0(size_t* bitpointer, unsigned char* bitstream, unsigned char bit)
2390
0
{
2391
0
  /*the current bit in bitstream must be 0 for this to work*/
2392
0

2393
0
  {
2394
0
    /*earlier bit of huffman code is in a lesser significant bit of an earlier byte*/
2395
0

2396
0
  }
2397
0
  ++(*bitpointer);

0

2401
static void setBitOfReversedStream(size_t* bitpointer, unsigned char* bitstream, unsigned char bit)
2402
1.81M
{
2403
1.81M
  /*the current bit in bitstream may be 0 or 1 for this to work*/
2404
1.81M
  if(bit == 0) bitstream[(*bitpointer) >> 3] &=  (unsigned char)(~(1 << (7 - ((*bitpointer) & 0x7))));
2405
170k
  else         bitstream[(*bitpointer) >> 3] |=  (1 << (7 - ((*bitpointer) & 0x7)));
2406
1.81M
  ++(*bitpointer);
2407
1.81M
}

2456
unsigned lodepng_chunk_check_crc(const unsigned char* chunk)
2457
12
{
2458
12
  unsigned length = lodepng_chunk_length(chunk);
2459
12
  unsigned CRC = lodepng_read32bitInt(&chunk[length + 8]);
2460
12
  /*the CRC is taken of the data and the 4 chunk type letters, not the length*/
2461
12
  unsigned checksum = lodepng_crc32(&chunk[4], length + 4);
2462
12
  if(CRC != checksum) return 1;
2463
12
  else return 0;
2464
12
}
2465
2466
void lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(unsigned char* chunk)
2467
8
{
2468
8
  unsigned length = lodepng_chunk_length(chunk);
2469
8
  unsigned CRC = lodepng_crc32(&chunk[4], length + 4);
2470
8
  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 8 + length, CRC);
2471
8
}

2504
unsigned lodepng_chunk_create(unsigned char** out, size_t* outlength, unsigned length,
2505
                              const char* type, const unsigned char* data)
2506
8
{
2507
8
  unsigned i;
2508
8

2509
8

2510
8

2511
8

2512
8
  if(!new_buffer) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2513
8
  (*out) = new_buffer;
2514
8
  (*outlength) = new_length;
2515
8

2516
8
2517
8

8

2519
8
2520
8

8

2523

8

2525
8
2526
8

2527
30.5k

2528
8
2529
8

8

2531
8
2532
8
  return 0;
2533
8
}

/* / Color types and such                                                   / */

2539
/*return type is a LodePNG error code*/
2540
static unsigned checkColorValidity(LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bd) /*bd = bitdepth*/
2541
10
{
2542
10
  switch(colortype)
2543
10
  {
2544
10
    case 0: if(!(bd == 1 || bd == 2 || bd == 4 || bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break; /*grey*/
2545
1
    case 2: if(!(                                 bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break; /*RGB*/
2546
6
    case 3: if(!(bd == 1 || bd == 2 || bd == 4 || bd == 8            )) return 37; break; /*palette*/
2547
6
    case 4: if(!(                                 bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break; /*grey + alpha*/
2548
3
    case 6: if(!(                                 bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break; /*RGBA*/
2549
3
    default: return 31;
2550
10
  }
2551
10
  return 0; /*allowed color type / bits combination*/
2552
10
}
2553
2554
static unsigned getNumColorChannels(LodePNGColorType colortype)
2555
37
{
2556
37
  switch(colortype)
2557
37
  {
2558
37
    case 0: return 1; /*grey*/
2559
37
    case 2: return 3; /*RGB*/
2560
37
    case 3: return 1; /*palette*/
2561
37
    case 4: return 2; /*grey + alpha*/
2562
37
    case 6: return 4; /*RGBA*/
2563
0
  }
2564
0
  return 0; /*unexisting color type*/
2565
0
}
2566
2567
static unsigned lodepng_get_bpp_lct(LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth)
2568
37
{
2569
37
  /*bits per pixel is amount of channels * bits per channel*/
2570
37
  return getNumColorChannels(colortype) * bitdepth;
2571
37
}

static int lodepng_color_mode_equal(const LodePNGColorMode* a, const LodePNGColorMode* b)

15

2607
15

2609

2614
0

2615
1
  }
2616
1
  /*if one of the palette sizes is 0, then we consider it to be the same as the
2617
1
  other: it means that e.g. the palette was not given by the user and should be
2618
1
  considered the same as the palette inside the PNG.*/
2619
1

2621
1

0
    {
2623
0

2624
0
    }
2625
1
  }

1
}

42

2636
unsigned lodepng_palette_add(LodePNGColorMode* info,

                             unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a)
2638
4
{
2639
4
  unsigned char* data;
2640
4
  /*the same resize technique as C++ std::vectors is used, and here it's made so that for a palette with
2641
4
  the max of 256 colors, it'll have the exact alloc size*/
2642
4
  if(!info->palette) /*allocate palette if empty*/
2643
2
  {
2644
2
    /*room for 256 colors with 4 bytes each*/
2645
2
    data = (unsigned char*)lodepng_realloc(info->palette, 1024);
2646
2
    if(!data) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2647
2
    else info->palette = data;
2648
2
  }
2649
4
  info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 0] = r;
2650
4
  info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 1] = g;
2651
4
  info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 2] = b;
2652
4
  info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 3] = a;
2653
4
  ++info->palettesize;
2654
4
  return 0;
2655
4
}

size_t lodepng_get_raw_size(unsigned w, unsigned h, const LodePNGColorMode* color)
2701
17
{
2702
17
  /*will not overflow for any color type if roughly w * h < 268435455*/
2703
17
  size_t bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(color);
2704
17
  size_t n = w * h;
2705
17
  return ((n / 8) * bpp) + ((n & 7) * bpp + 7) / 8;
2706
17
}

2970
/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2971
2972
/*index: bitgroup index, bits: bitgroup size(1, 2 or 4), in: bitgroup value, out: octet array to add bits to*/
2973
static void addColorBits(unsigned char* out, size_t index, unsigned bits, unsigned in)
2974
602k
{
2975
602k
  unsigned m = bits == 1 ? 7 : bits == 2 ? 3 : 1; /*8 / bits - 1*/
2976
602k
  /*p = the partial index in the byte, e.g. with 4 palettebits it is 0 for first half or 1 for second half*/
2977
602k
  unsigned p = index & m;
2978
602k
  in &= (1u << bits) - 1u; /*filter out any other bits of the input value*/
2979
602k
  in = in << (bits * (m - p));
2980
602k
  if(p == 0) out[index * bits / 8] = in;
2981
527k
  else out[index * bits / 8] |= in;
2982
602k
}
2983
2984
typedef struct ColorTree ColorTree;
2985
2986
/*
2987
One node of a color tree
2988
This is the data structure used to count the number of unique colors and to get a palette
2989
index for a color. It's like an octree, but because the alpha channel is used too, each
2990
node has 16 instead of 8 children.
2991
*/
2992
struct ColorTree
2993
{
2994
  ColorTree* children[16]; /*up to 16 pointers to ColorTree of next level*/
2995
  int index; /*the payload. Only has a meaningful value if this is in the last level*/
2996
};
2997
2998
static void color_tree_init(ColorTree* tree)
2999
68
{
3000
68
  int i;
3001
1.15k
  for(i = 0; i != 16; ++i) tree->children[i] = 0;
3002
68
  tree->index = -1;
3003
68
}
3004
3005
static void color_tree_cleanup(ColorTree* tree)
3006
68
{
3007
68
  int i;
3008
1.15k
  for(i = 0; i != 16; ++i)
3009
1.08k
  {
3010
1.08k
    if(tree->children[i])
3011
64
    {
3012
64
      color_tree_cleanup(tree->children[i]);
3013
64
      lodepng_free(tree->children[i]);
3014
64
    }
3015
1.08k
  }
3016
68
}
3017
3018
/*returns -1 if color not present, its index otherwise*/
3019
static int color_tree_get(ColorTree* tree, unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a)
3020
1.20M
{
3021
1.20M
  int bit = 0;
3022
10.8M
  for(bit = 0; bit < 8; ++bit)
3023
9.63M
  {
3024
9.63M
    int i = 8 * ((r >> bit) & 1) + 4 * ((g >> bit) & 1) + 2 * ((b >> bit) & 1) + 1 * ((a >> bit) & 1);
3025
9.63M
    if(!tree->children[i]) return -1;
3026
9.63M
    else tree = tree->children[i];
3027
9.63M
  }
3028
1.20M
  return tree ? tree->index : -1;
3029
1.20M
}
3030
3031
#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
3032
static int color_tree_has(ColorTree* tree, unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a)
3033
602k
{
3034
602k
  return color_tree_get(tree, r, g, b, a) >= 0;
3035
602k
}
3036
#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
3037
3038
/*color is not allowed to already exist.
3039
Index should be >= 0 (it's signed to be compatible with using -1 for "doesn't exist")*/
3040
static void color_tree_add(ColorTree* tree,
3041
                           unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a, unsigned index)
3042
8
{
3043
8
  int bit;
3044
72
  for(bit = 0; bit < 8; ++bit)
3045
64
  {
3046
64
    int i = 8 * ((r >> bit) & 1) + 4 * ((g >> bit) & 1) + 2 * ((b >> bit) & 1) + 1 * ((a >> bit) & 1);
3047
64
    if(!tree->children[i])
3048
64
    {
3049
64
      tree->children[i] = (ColorTree*)lodepng_malloc(sizeof(ColorTree));
3050
64
      color_tree_init(tree->children[i]);
3051
64
    }
3052
64
    tree = tree->children[i];
3053
64
  }
3054
8
  tree->index = (int)index;
3055
8
}
3056
3057
/*put a pixel, given its RGBA color, into image of any color type*/
3058
static unsigned rgba8ToPixel(unsigned char* out, size_t i,
3059
                             const LodePNGColorMode* mode, ColorTree* tree /*for palette*/,
3060
                             unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a)
3061
602k
{
3062
602k
  if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY)
3063
0
  {
3064
0
    unsigned char grey = r; /*((unsigned short)r + g + b) / 3*/;
3065
0
    if(mode->bitdepth == 8) out[i] = grey;
3066
0
    else if(mode->bitdepth == 16) out[i * 2 + 0] = out[i * 2 + 1] = grey;
3067
0
    else
3068
0
    {
3069
0
      /*take the most significant bits of grey*/
3070
0
      grey = (grey >> (8 - mode->bitdepth)) & ((1 << mode->bitdepth) - 1);
3071
0
      addColorBits(out, i, mode->bitdepth, grey);
3072
0
    }
3073
0
  }
3074
602k
  else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGB)
3075
0
  {
3076
0
    if(mode->bitdepth == 8)
3077
0
    {

/*put a pixel, given its RGBA16 color, into image of any color 16-bitdepth type*/
3132
static void rgba16ToPixel(unsigned char* out, size_t i,
3133
                         const LodePNGColorMode* mode,
3134
                         unsigned short r, unsigned short g, unsigned short b, unsigned short a)
3135
0
{
3136
0
  if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY)
3137
0
  {
3138
0
    unsigned short grey = r; /*((unsigned)r + g + b) / 3*/;
3139
0
    out[i * 2 + 0] = (grey >> 8) & 255;
3140
0
    out[i * 2 + 1] = grey & 255;
3141
0
  }
3142
0
  else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGB)
3143
0
  {
3144
0
    out[i * 6 + 0] = (r >> 8) & 255;
3145
0
    out[i * 6 + 1] = r & 255;
3146
0
    out[i * 6 + 2] = (g >> 8) & 255;
3147
0
    out[i * 6 + 3] = g & 255;
3148
0
    out[i * 6 + 4] = (b >> 8) & 255;
3149
0
    out[i * 6 + 5] = b & 255;
3150
0
  }
3151
0
  else if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA)
3152
0
  {
3153
0
    unsigned short grey = r; /*((unsigned)r + g + b) / 3*/;
3154
0
    out[i * 4 + 0] = (grey >> 8) & 255;
3155
0
    out[i * 4 + 1] = grey & 255;
3156
0
    out[i * 4 + 2] = (a >> 8) & 255;
3157
0
    out[i * 4 + 3] = a & 255;
3158
0
  }
3159
0
  else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA)
3160
0
  {
3161
0
    out[i * 8 + 0] = (r >> 8) & 255;
3162
0
    out[i * 8 + 1] = r & 255;
3163
0
    out[i * 8 + 2] = (g >> 8) & 255;
3164
0

3165

3166

/*Get RGBA8 color of pixel with index i (y * width + x) from the raw image with given color type.*/
3173

3174
                               unsigned char* b, unsigned char* a,
3175
                               const unsigned char* in, size_t i,

3177

/*Get RGBA16 color of pixel with index i (y * width + x) from the raw image with
3416
given color type, but the given color type must be 16-bit itself.*/
3417
static void getPixelColorRGBA16(unsigned short* r, unsigned short* g, unsigned short* b, unsigned short* a,
3418
                                const unsigned char* in, size_t i, const LodePNGColorMode* mode)
3419
0
{
3420
0
  if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY)
3421
0
  {
3422
0
    *r = *g = *b = 256 * in[i * 2 + 0] + in[i * 2 + 1];
3423
0
    if(mode->key_defined && 256U * in[i * 2 + 0] + in[i * 2 + 1] == mode->key_r) *a = 0;
3424
0
    else *a = 65535;
3425
0
  }
3426
0
  else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGB)
3427
0
  {
3428
0
    *r = 256u * in[i * 6 + 0] + in[i * 6 + 1];
3429
0
    *g = 256u * in[i * 6 + 2] + in[i * 6 + 3];
3430
0
    *b = 256u * in[i * 6 + 4] + in[i * 6 + 5];
3431
0
    if(mode->key_defined
3432
0
       && 256u * in[i * 6 + 0] + in[i * 6 + 1] == mode->key_r
3433
0
       && 256u * in[i * 6 + 2] + in[i * 6 + 3] == mode->key_g
3434
0
       && 256u * in[i * 6 + 4] + in[i * 6 + 5] == mode->key_b) *a = 0;
3435
0
    else *a = 65535;
3436
0
  }
3437
0
  else if(mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA)
3438
0
  {
3439
0
    *r = *g = *b = 256u * in[i * 4 + 0] + in[i * 4 + 1];
3440
0
    *a = 256u * in[i * 4 + 2] + in[i * 4 + 3];
3441
0
  }
3442
0
  else if(mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA)
3443
0
  {
3444
0
    *r = 256u * in[i * 8 + 0] + in[i * 8 + 1];
3445
0
    *g = 256u * in[i * 8 + 2] + in[i * 8 + 3];
3446
0
    *b = 256u * in[i * 8 + 4] + in[i * 8 + 5];
3447
0
    *a = 256u * in[i * 8 + 6] + in[i * 8 + 7];

0
  }

3450
3451
unsigned lodepng_convert(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in,
3452
                         const LodePNGColorMode* mode_out, const LodePNGColorMode* mode_in,
3453
                         unsigned w, unsigned h)
3454
7
{
3455
7
  size_t i;
3456
7
  ColorTree tree;
3457
7
  size_t numpixels = w * h;
3458
7
3459
7
  if(lodepng_color_mode_equal(mode_out, mode_in))
3460
0
  {
3461
0
    size_t numbytes = lodepng_get_raw_size(w, h, mode_in);
3462
0
    for(i = 0; i != numbytes; ++i) out[i] = in[i];
3463
0
    return 0;
3464
0
  }
3465
7
3466
7
  if(mode_out->colortype == LCT_PALETTE)
3467
2
  {
3468
2
    size_t palettesize = mode_out->palettesize;
3469
2
    const unsigned char* palette = mode_out->palette;
3470
2
    size_t palsize = 1u << mode_out->bitdepth;
3471
2
    /*if the user specified output palette but did not give the values, assume
3472
2
    they want the values of the input color type (assuming that one is palette).
3473
2
    Note that we never create a new palette ourselves.*/
3474
2
    if(palettesize == 0)
3475
0
    {
3476
0
      palettesize = mode_in->palettesize;
3477
0
      palette = mode_in->palette;
3478
0
    }
3479
2
    if(palettesize < palsize) palsize = palettesize;
3480
2
    color_tree_init(&tree);
3481
6
    for(i = 0; i != palsize; ++i)
3482
4
    {
3483
4
      const unsigned char* p = &palette[i * 4];
3484
4
      color_tree_add(&tree, p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3], i);
3485
4
    }
3486
2
  }
3487
7
3488
7
  if(mode_in->bitdepth == 16 && mode_out->bitdepth == 16)
3489
0
  {
3490
0
    for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i)
3491
0

3492
0
      unsigned short r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3493
0

3494
0
      rgba16ToPixel(out, i, mode_out, r, g, b, a);
3495
0
    }
3496
0
  }
3497
7

3498

3499
5

3500
5
  }
3501
2

3502
0
  {
3503
0

3504
0

3505
2

3506

3507

3509

3510
602k

3511
602k

3512
602k

3513

3514

3515

3525
void lodepng_color_profile_init(LodePNGColorProfile* profile)

3527
2

3530

  profile->alpha = 0;
3531

3532

3533
2

3548
/*Returns how many bits needed to represent given value (max 8 bit)*/
3549
static unsigned getValueRequiredBits(unsigned char value)
3550
6.21k
{
3551
6.21k
  if(value == 0 || value == 255) return 1;
3552
2
  /*The scaling of 2-bit and 4-bit values uses multiples of 85 and 17*/
3553
2
  if(value % 17 == 0) return value % 85 == 0 ? 2 : 4;
3554
2
  return 8;
3555
2
}
3556
3557
/*profile must already have been inited with mode.
3558
It's ok to set some parameters of profile to done already.*/
3559
unsigned lodepng_get_color_profile(LodePNGColorProfile* profile,
3560
                                   const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
3561
                                   const LodePNGColorMode* mode)
3562
2
{
3563
2
  unsigned error = 0;
3564
2
  size_t i;
3565
2
  ColorTree tree;
3566
2
  size_t numpixels = w * h;
3567
2
3568
2
  unsigned colored_done = lodepng_is_greyscale_type(mode) ? 1 : 0;
3569
2
  unsigned alpha_done = lodepng_can_have_alpha(mode) ? 0 : 1;
3570
2
  unsigned numcolors_done = 0;
3571
2
  unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(mode);
3572
2
  unsigned bits_done = bpp == 1 ? 1 : 0;
3573
2
  unsigned maxnumcolors = 257;
3574
2
  unsigned sixteen = 0;
3575
2
  if(bpp <= 8) maxnumcolors = bpp == 1 ? 2 : (bpp == 2 ? 4 : (bpp == 4 ? 16 : 256));
3576
2
3577
2
  color_tree_init(&tree);
3578
2
3579
2
  /*Check if the 16-bit input is truly 16-bit*/
3580
2
  if(mode->bitdepth == 16)
3581
0
  {
3582
0
    unsigned short r, g, b, a;
3583
0
    for(i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i)
3584
0
    {
3585
0
      getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode);
3586
0
      if((r & 255) != ((r >> 8) & 255) || (g & 255) != ((g >> 8) & 255) ||
3587
0
         (b & 255) != ((b >> 8) & 255) || (a & 255) != ((a >> 8) & 255)) /*first and second byte differ*/
3588
0
      {
3589
0
        sixteen = 1;
3590
0
        break;
3591
0
      }
3592
0
    }
3593
0
  }
3594
2
3595
2
  if(sixteen)
3596
0
  {
3597
0
    unsigned short r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3598

    profile->bits = 16;
3599
0

3601
0

0

3603

3604
0
3605
0

3607

3608

3609
0

3610
0
3611

3612
0
      {
3613
0

3614
0
        if(a != 65535 && (a != 0 || (profile->key && !matchkey)))
3615
0

3616
0
          profile->alpha = 1;
3617

          profile->key = 0;

3619

3750
/*Automatically chooses color type that gives smallest amount of bits in the
3751
output image, e.g. grey if there are only greyscale pixels, palette if there
3752
are less than 256 colors, ...
3753
Updates values of mode with a potentially smaller color model. mode_out should
3754
contain the user chosen color model, but will be overwritten with the new chosen one.*/
3755
unsigned lodepng_auto_choose_color(LodePNGColorMode* mode_out,
3756
                                   const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h,
3757
                                   const LodePNGColorMode* mode_in)
3758
2
{
3759
2
  LodePNGColorProfile prof;
3760
2
  unsigned error = 0;
3761
2
  unsigned i, n, palettebits, palette_ok;
3762
2
3763
2
  lodepng_color_profile_init(&prof);
3764
2
  error = lodepng_get_color_profile(&prof, image, w, h, mode_in);
3765
2
  if(error) return error;
3766
2
  mode_out->key_defined = 0;
3767
2
3768
2
  if(prof.key && w * h <= 16)
3769
0
  {
3770
0
    prof.alpha = 1; /*too few pixels to justify tRNS chunk overhead*/
3771
0
    prof.key = 0;
3772
0
    if(prof.bits < 8) prof.bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3773
0
  }
3774
2
  n = prof.numcolors;
3775
2
  palettebits = n <= 2 ? 1 : (n <= 4 ? 2 : (n <= 16 ? 4 : 8));
3776
2
  palette_ok = n <= 256 && prof.bits <= 8;
3777
2
  if(w * h < n * 2) palette_ok = 0; /*don't add palette overhead if image has only a few pixels*/
3778
2
  if(!prof.colored && prof.bits <= palettebits) palette_ok = 0; /*grey is less overhead*/
3779
2
3780
2
  if(palette_ok)
3781
2
  {
3782
2
    unsigned char* p = prof.palette;
3783
2
    lodepng_palette_clear(mode_out); /*remove potential earlier palette*/
3784
6
    for(i = 0; i != prof.numcolors; ++i)
3785
4
    {
3786
4
      error = lodepng_palette_add(mode_out, p[i * 4 + 0], p[i * 4 + 1], p[i * 4 + 2], p[i * 4 + 3]);
3787
4
      if(error) break;
3788
4
    }
3789
2
3790
2
    mode_out->colortype = LCT_PALETTE;
3791
2
    mode_out->bitdepth = palettebits;
3792
2
3793
2
    if(mode_in->colortype == LCT_PALETTE && mode_in->palettesize >= mode_out->palettesize
3794
2
        && mode_in->bitdepth == mode_out->bitdepth)
3795
0
    {
3796
0
      /*If input should have same palette colors, keep original to preserve its order and prevent conversion*/
3797
0
      lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(mode_out);
3798
0
      lodepng_color_mode_copy(mode_out, mode_in);
3799
0
    }
3800
2
  }
3801
0
  else /*8-bit or 16-bit per channel*/
3802
0
  {
3803
0
    mode_out->bitdepth = prof.bits;
3804
0
    mode_out->colortype = prof.alpha ? (prof.colored ? LCT_RGBA : LCT_GREY_ALPHA)
3805
0
                                     : (prof.colored ? LCT_RGB : LCT_GREY);
3806
0
3807
0
    if(prof.key)
3808
0
    {
3809
0
      unsigned mask = (1u << mode_out->bitdepth) - 1u; /*profile always uses 16-bit, mask converts it*/
3810
0
      mode_out->key_r = prof.key_r & mask;
3811
0
      mode_out->key_g = prof.key_g & mask;
3812
0
      mode_out->key_b = prof.key_b & mask;
3813
0
      mode_out->key_defined = 1;
3814
0
    }
3815
0
  }
3816
2
3817
2
  return error;
3818
2
}

3821
3822
/*
3823
Paeth predicter, used by PNG filter type 4
3824
The parameters are of type short, but should come from unsigned chars, the shorts
3825
are only needed to make the paeth calculation correct.
3826
*/
3827
static unsigned char paethPredictor(short a, short b, short c)
3828
567k
{
3829
567k
  short pa = abs(b - c);
3830
567k
  short pb = abs(a - c);
3831
567k
  short pc = abs(a + b - c - c);
3832
567k
3833
567k
  if(pc < pa && pc < pb) return (unsigned char)c;
3834
514k
  else if(pb < pa) return (unsigned char)b;
3835
351k
  else return (unsigned char)a;
3836
567k
}
3837
3838
/*shared values used by multiple Adam7 related functions*/
3839
3840
static const unsigned ADAM7_IX[7] = { 0, 4, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0 }; /*x start values*/
3841
static const unsigned ADAM7_IY[7] = { 0, 0, 4, 0, 2, 0, 1 }; /*y start values*/
3842
static const unsigned ADAM7_DX[7] = { 8, 8, 4, 4, 2, 2, 1 }; /*x delta values*/
3843
static const unsigned ADAM7_DY[7] = { 8, 8, 8, 4, 4, 2, 2 }; /*y delta values*/
3844
3845
/*
3846
Outputs various dimensions and positions in the image related to the Adam7 reduced images.
3847
passw: output containing the width of the 7 passes
3848
passh: output containing the height of the 7 passes
3849
filter_passstart: output containing the index of the start and end of each
3850
 reduced image with filter bytes
3851
padded_passstart output containing the index of the start and end of each
3852
 reduced image when without filter bytes but with padded scanlines
3853
passstart: output containing the index of the start and end of each reduced
3854
 image without padding between scanlines, but still padding between the images
3855
w, h: width and height of non-interlaced image
3856
bpp: bits per pixel
3857
"padded" is only relevant if bpp is less than 8 and a scanline or image does not
3858
 end at a full byte
3859
*/
3860
static void Adam7_getpassvalues(unsigned passw[7], unsigned passh[7], size_t filter_passstart[8],
3861
                                size_t padded_passstart[8], size_t passstart[8], unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp)
3862
0
{
3863
0
  /*the passstart values have 8 values: the 8th one indicates the byte after the end of the 7th (= last) pass*/
3864
0
  unsigned i;
3865
0
3866
0
  /*calculate width and height in pixels of each pass*/
3867
0
  for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i)
3868
0
  {
3869
0
    passw[i] = (w + ADAM7_DX[i] - ADAM7_IX[i] - 1) / ADAM7_DX[i];
3870
0
    passh[i] = (h + ADAM7_DY[i] - ADAM7_IY[i] - 1) / ADAM7_DY[i];
3871
0
    if(passw[i] == 0) passh[i] = 0;
3872
0
    if(passh[i] == 0) passw[i] = 0;
3873
0
  }
3874
0
3875
0
  filter_passstart[0] = padded_passstart[0] = passstart[0] = 0;
3876
0
  for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i)
3877
0
  {
3878
0
    /*if passw[i] is 0, it's 0 bytes, not 1 (no filtertype-byte)*/
3879
0
    filter_passstart[i + 1] = filter_passstart[i]
3880
0
                            + ((passw[i] && passh[i]) ? passh[i] * (1 + (passw[i] * bpp + 7) / 8) : 0);
3881
0
    /*bits padded if needed to fill full byte at end of each scanline*/
3882
0
    padded_passstart[i + 1] = padded_passstart[i] + passh[i] * ((passw[i] * bpp + 7) / 8);
3883
0
    /*only padded at end of reduced image*/
3884
0
    passstart[i + 1] = passstart[i] + (passh[i] * passw[i] * bpp + 7) / 8;
3885
0
  }
3886
0
}
3887
3888
#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
3889
3890
/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
3891
/* / PNG Decoder                                                            / */
3892
/* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
3893
3894
/*read the information from the header and store it in the LodePNGInfo. return value is error*/
3895
unsigned lodepng_inspect(unsigned* w, unsigned* h, LodePNGState* state,
3896
                         const unsigned char* in, size_t insize)
3897
6
{
3898
6
  LodePNGInfo* info = &state->info_png;
3899
6
  if(insize == 0 || in == 0)
3900
0
  {
3901
0
    CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 48); /*error: the given data is empty*/
3902
0
  }
3903
6
  if(insize < 33)
3904
0
  {
3905
0
    CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 27); /*error: the data length is smaller than the length of a PNG header*/
3906
0
  }
3907
6
3908
6
  /*when decoding a new PNG image, make sure all parameters created after previous decoding are reset*/
3909
6
  lodepng_info_cleanup(info);
3910
6
  lodepng_info_init(info);
3911
6
3912
6
  if(in[0] != 137 || in[1] != 80 || in[2] != 78 || in[3] != 71
3913
6
     || in[4] != 13 || in[5] != 10 || in[6] != 26 || in[7] != 10)
3914
0
  {
3915
0
    CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 28); /*error: the first 8 bytes are not the correct PNG signature*/
3916
0
  }
3917
6
  if(lodepng_chunk_length(in + 8) != 13)
3918
0
  {
3919
0
    CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 94); /*error: header size must be 13 bytes*/
3920
0
  }
3921
6
  if(!lodepng_chunk_type_equals(in + 8, "IHDR"))
3922
0
  {
3923
0
    CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 29); /*error: it doesn't start with a IHDR chunk!*/
3924
0
  }
3925
6
3926
6
  /*read the values given in the header*/
3927
6
  *w = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[16]);
3928
6
  *h = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[20]);
3929
6
  info->color.bitdepth = in[24];
3930
6
  info->color.colortype = (LodePNGColorType)in[25];
3931
6
  info->compression_method = in[26];
3932
6
  info->filter_method = in[27];
3933
6
  info->interlace_method = in[28];
3934
6
3935
6
  if(*w == 0 || *h == 0)
3936
0
  {
3937
0
    CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 93);
3938
0
  }
3939
6
3940
6
  if(!state->decoder.ignore_crc)
3941
6
  {
3942
6
    unsigned CRC = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[29]);
3943
6
    unsigned checksum = lodepng_crc32(&in[12], 17);
3944
6
    if(CRC != checksum)
3945
0
    {
3946
0
      CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 57); /*invalid CRC*/
3947
0
    }
3948
6
  }
3949
6
3950
6
  /*error: only compression method 0 is allowed in the specification*/
3951
6
  if(info->compression_method != 0) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 32);
3952
6
  /*error: only filter method 0 is allowed in the specification*/
3953
6
  if(info->filter_method != 0) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 33);
3954
6
  /*error: only interlace methods 0 and 1 exist in the specification*/
3955
6
  if(info->interlace_method > 1) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 34);
3956
6
3957
6
  state->error = checkColorValidity(info->color.colortype, info->color.bitdepth);
3958
6
  return state->error;
3959
6
}
3960
3961
static unsigned unfilterScanline(unsigned char* recon, const unsigned char* scanline, const unsigned char* precon,
3962
                                 size_t bytewidth, unsigned char filterType, size_t length)
3963
2.55k
{
3964
2.55k
  /*
3965
2.55k
  For PNG filter method 0
3966
2.55k
  unfilter a PNG image scanline by scanline. when the pixels are smaller than 1 byte,
3967
2.55k
  the filter works byte per byte (bytewidth = 1)
3968
2.55k
  precon is the previous unfiltered scanline, recon the result, scanline the current one
3969
2.55k
  the incoming scanlines do NOT include the filtertype byte, that one is given in the parameter filterType instead
3970
2.55k
  recon and scanline MAY be the same memory address! precon must be disjoint.
3971
2.55k
  */
3972
2.55k
3973
2.55k
  size_t i;
3974
2.55k
  switch(filterType)
3975
2.55k
  {
3976
2.55k
    case 0:
3977
154k
      for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
3978
1.70k
      break;
3979
2.55k
    case 1:
3980
250
      for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
3981
59.3k
      for(i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + recon[i - bytewidth];
3982
51
      break;
3983
2.55k
    case 2:
3984
91
      if(precon)
3985
91
      {
3986
91.0k
        for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + precon[i];
3987
91
      }
3988
0
      else
3989
0
      {
3990
0
        for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
3991
0
      }
3992
91
      break;
3993
2.55k
    case 3:
3994
428
      if(precon)
3995
428
      {
3996
1.71k
        for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + (precon[i] >> 1);
3997
1.14M
        for(i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + ((recon[i - bytewidth] + precon[i]) >> 1);
3998
428
      }
3999
0
      else
4000
0
      {
4001
0
        for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4002
0
        for(i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + (recon[i - bytewidth] >> 1);
4003
0
      }
4004
428
      break;
4005
2.55k
    case 4:
4006
279
      if(precon)
4007
279
      {
4008
1.22k
        for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i)
4009
946
        {
4010
946
          recon[i] = (scanline[i] + precon[i]); /*paethPredictor(0, precon[i], 0) is always precon[i]*/
4011
946
        }
4012
567k
        for(i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i)
4013
567k
        {
4014
567k
          recon[i] = (scanline[i] + paethPredictor(recon[i - bytewidth], precon[i], precon[i - bytewidth]));
4015
567k
        }
4016
279
      }
4017
0
      else
4018
0
      {
4019
0
        for(i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i)
4020
0
        {
4021
0
          recon[i] = scanline[i];
4022
0
        }
4023
0
        for(i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i)
4024
0
        {
4025
0
          /*paethPredictor(recon[i - bytewidth], 0, 0) is always recon[i - bytewidth]*/
4026
0
          recon[i] = (scanline[i] + recon[i - bytewidth]);
4027
0
        }
4028
0
      }
4029
279
      break;
4030
2.55k
    default: return 36; /*error: unexisting filter type given*/
4031
2.55k
  }
4032
2.55k
  return 0;
4033
2.55k
}
4034
4035
static unsigned unfilter(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp)
4036
6
{
4037
6
  /*
4038
6
  For PNG filter method 0
4039
6
  this function unfilters a single image (e.g. without interlacing this is called once, with Adam7 seven times)
4040
6
  out must have enough bytes allocated already, in must have the scanlines + 1 filtertype byte per scanline
4041
6
  w and h are image dimensions or dimensions of reduced image, bpp is bits per pixel
4042
6
  in and out are allowed to be the same memory address (but aren't the same size since in has the extra filter bytes)
4043
6
  */
4044
6
4045
6
  unsigned y;
4046
6
  unsigned char* prevline = 0;
4047
6
4048
6
  /*bytewidth is used for filtering, is 1 when bpp < 8, number of bytes per pixel otherwise*/
4049
6
  size_t bytewidth = (bpp + 7) / 8;
4050
6
  size_t linebytes = (w * bpp + 7) / 8;
4051
6
4052
2.55k
  for(y = 0; y < h; ++y)
4053
2.55k
  {
4054
2.55k
    size_t outindex = linebytes * y;
4055
2.55k
    size_t inindex = (1 + linebytes) * y; /*the extra filterbyte added to each row*/
4056
2.55k
    unsigned char filterType = in[inindex];
4057
2.55k
4058
2.55k
    CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilterScanline(&out[outindex], &in[inindex + 1], prevline, bytewidth, filterType, linebytes));
4059
2.55k
4060
2.55k
    prevline = &out[outindex];
4061
2.55k
  }
4062
6
4063
6
  return 0;
4064
6
}
4065
4066
/*
4067
in: Adam7 interlaced image, with no padding bits between scanlines, but between
4068
 reduced images so that each reduced image starts at a byte.
4069
out: the same pixels, but re-ordered so that they're now a non-interlaced image with size w*h
4070
bpp: bits per pixel
4071
out has the following size in bits: w * h * bpp.
4072
in is possibly bigger due to padding bits between reduced images.
4073
out must be big enough AND must be 0 everywhere if bpp < 8 in the current implementation
4074
(because that's likely a little bit faster)
4075
NOTE: comments about padding bits are only relevant if bpp < 8
4076
*/
4077
static void Adam7_deinterlace(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp)
4078
0
{
4079
0
  unsigned passw[7], passh[7];
4080
0
  size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
4081
0
  unsigned i;
4082
0
4083
0
  Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
4084
0
4085
0
  if(bpp >= 8)
4086
0
  {
4087
0
    for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i)
4088
0
    {
4089
0
      unsigned x, y, b;
4090
0
      size_t bytewidth = bpp / 8;
4091
0
      for(y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
4092
0
      for(x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x)
4093
0
      {
4094
0
        size_t pixelinstart = passstart[i] + (y * passw[i] + x) * bytewidth;
4095
0
        size_t pixeloutstart = ((ADAM7_IY[i] + y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * w + ADAM7_IX[i] + x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bytewidth;
4096
0
        for(b = 0; b < bytewidth; ++b)
4097
0
        {
4098
0
          out[pixeloutstart + b] = in[pixelinstart + b];
4099
0
        }
4100
0
      }
4101
0
    }
4102
0
  }
4103
0
  else /*bpp < 8: Adam7 with pixels < 8 bit is a bit trickier: with bit pointers*/
4104
0
  {
4105
0
    for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i)
4106
0
    {
4107
0
      unsigned x, y, b;
4108
0
      unsigned ilinebits = bpp * passw[i];
4109
0
      unsigned olinebits = bpp * w;
4110
0
      size_t obp, ibp; /*bit pointers (for out and in buffer)*/
4111
0
      for(y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
4112
0
      for(x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x)
4113
0
      {
4114
0
        ibp = (8 * passstart[i]) + (y * ilinebits + x * bpp);
4115
0
        obp = (ADAM7_IY[i] + y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * olinebits + (ADAM7_IX[i] + x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bpp;
4116
0
        for(b = 0; b < bpp; ++b)
4117
0
        {
4118
0
          unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
4119
0
          /*note that this function assumes the out buffer is completely 0, use setBitOfReversedStream otherwise*/
4120
0
          setBitOfReversedStream0(&obp, out, bit);
4121
0
        }
4122
0
      }
4123
0
    }
4124
0
  }
4125
0
}
4126
4127
static void removePaddingBits(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in,
4128
                              size_t olinebits, size_t ilinebits, unsigned h)
4129
4
{
4130
4
  /*
4131
4
  After filtering there are still padding bits if scanlines have non multiple of 8 bit amounts. They need
4132
4
  to be removed (except at last scanline of (Adam7-reduced) image) before working with pure image buffers
4133
4
  for the Adam7 code, the color convert code and the output to the user.
4134
4
  in and out are allowed to be the same buffer, in may also be higher but still overlapping; in must
4135
4
  have >= ilinebits*h bits, out must have >= olinebits*h bits, olinebits must be <= ilinebits
4136
4
  also used to move bits after earlier such operations happened, e.g. in a sequence of reduced images from Adam7
4137
4
  only useful if (ilinebits - olinebits) is a value in the range 1..7
4138
4
  */
4139
4
  unsigned y;
4140
4
  size_t diff = ilinebits - olinebits;
4141
4
  size_t ibp = 0, obp = 0; /*input and output bit pointers*/
4142
1.70k
  for(y = 0; y < h; ++y)
4143
1.70k
  {
4144
1.70k
    size_t x;
4145
1.20M
    for(x = 0; x < olinebits; ++x)
4146
1.20M
    {
4147
1.20M
      unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
4148
1.20M
      setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, bit);
4149
1.20M
    }
4150
1.70k
    ibp += diff;
4151
1.70k
  }
4152
4
}
4153
4154
/*out must be buffer big enough to contain full image, and in must contain the full decompressed data from
4155
the IDAT chunks (with filter index bytes and possible padding bits)
4156
return value is error*/
4157
static unsigned postProcessScanlines(unsigned char* out, unsigned char* in,
4158
                                     unsigned w, unsigned h, const LodePNGInfo* info_png)
4159
6
{
4160
6
  /*
4161
6
  This function converts the filtered-padded-interlaced data into pure 2D image buffer with the PNG's colortype.
4162
6
  Steps:
4163
6
  *) if no Adam7: 1) unfilter 2) remove padding bits (= posible extra bits per scanline if bpp < 8)
4164
6
  *) if adam7: 1) 7x unfilter 2) 7x remove padding bits 3) Adam7_deinterlace
4165
6
  NOTE: the in buffer will be overwritten with intermediate data!
4166
6
  */
4167
6
  unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&info_png->color);
4168
6
  if(bpp == 0) return 31; /*error: invalid colortype*/
4169
6
4170
6
  if(info_png->interlace_method == 0)
4171
6
  {
4172
6
    if(bpp < 8 && w * bpp != ((w * bpp + 7) / 8) * 8)
4173
4
    {
4174
4
      CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(in, in, w, h, bpp));
4175
4
      removePaddingBits(out, in, w * bpp, ((w * bpp + 7) / 8) * 8, h);
4176
4
    }
4177
6
    /*we can immediately filter into the out buffer, no other steps needed*/
4178
6
    else CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(out, in, w, h, bpp));
4179
6
  }
4180
0
  else /*interlace_method is 1 (Adam7)*/
4181
0
  {
4182
0
    unsigned passw[7], passh[7]; size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
4183
0
    unsigned i;
4184
0
4185
0
    Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
4186
0
4187
0
    for(i = 0; i != 7; ++i)
4188
0
    {
4189
0
      CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(&in[padded_passstart[i]], &in[filter_passstart[i]], passw[i], passh[i], bpp));
4190
0
      /*TODO: possible efficiency improvement: if in this reduced image the bits fit nicely in 1 scanline,
4191
0
      move bytes instead of bits or move not at all*/
4192
0
      if(bpp < 8)
4193
0
      {
4194
0
        /*remove padding bits in scanlines; after this there still may be padding
4195
0
        bits between the different reduced images: each reduced image still starts nicely at a byte*/
4196
0
        removePaddingBits(&in[passstart[i]], &in[padded_passstart[i]], passw[i] * bpp,
4197
0
                          ((passw[i] * bpp + 7) / 8) * 8, passh[i]);
4198
0
      }
4199
0
    }
4200
0
4201
0
    Adam7_deinterlace(out, in, w, h, bpp);
4202
0
  }
4203
6
4204
6
  return 0;
4205
6
}

static unsigned readChunk_PLTE(LodePNGColorMode* color, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength)
4208
4
{
4209
4
  unsigned pos = 0, i;
4210
4
  if(color->palette) lodepng_free(color->palette);
4211
4
  color->palettesize = chunkLength / 3;
4212
4
  color->palette = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(4 * color->palettesize);
4213
4
  if(!color->palette && color->palettesize)
4214
0
  {
4215
0
    color->palettesize = 0;
4216
0
    return 83; /*alloc fail*/
4217
0
  }
4218
4
  if(color->palettesize > 256) return 38; /*error: palette too big*/
4219
4
4220
12
  for(i = 0; i != color->palettesize; ++i)
4221
8
  {
4222
8
    color->palette[4 * i + 0] = data[pos++]; /*R*/
4223
8
    color->palette[4 * i + 1] = data[pos++]; /*G*/
4224
8
    color->palette[4 * i + 2] = data[pos++]; /*B*/
4225
8
    color->palette[4 * i + 3] = 255; /*alpha*/
4226
8
  }
4227
4
4228
4
  return 0; /* OK */
4229
4
}

static unsigned readChunk_tRNS(LodePNGColorMode* color, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength)
4232
0
{
4233
0
  unsigned i;
4234
0
  if(color->colortype == LCT_PALETTE)
4235
0
  {
4236
0
    /*error: more alpha values given than there are palette entries*/
4237
0
    if(chunkLength > color->palettesize) return 38;
4238
0
4239
0
    for(i = 0; i != chunkLength; ++i) color->palette[4 * i + 3] = data[i];
4240
0
  }
4241
0
  else if(color->colortype == LCT_GREY)
4242
0
  {
4243
0
    /*error: this chunk must be 2 bytes for greyscale image*/
4244
0
    if(chunkLength != 2) return 30;
4245
0
4246
0
    color->key_defined = 1;
4247
0
    color->key_r = color->key_g = color->key_b = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4248
0
  }
4249
0
  else if(color->colortype == LCT_RGB)
4250
0
  {
4251
0
    /*error: this chunk must be 6 bytes for RGB image*/
4252
0
    if(chunkLength != 6) return 41;
4253
0
4254
0
    color->key_defined = 1;
4255
0
    color->key_r = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4256
0
    color->key_g = 256u * data[2] + data[3];
4257
0
    color->key_b = 256u * data[4] + data[5];
4258
0
  }
4259
0
  else return 42; /*error: tRNS chunk not allowed for other color models*/
4260
0
4261
0
  return 0; /* OK */
4262
0
}

4275
0

4299
/*text chunk (tEXt)*/
4300
static unsigned readChunk_tEXt(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength)
4301
2
{
4302
2
  unsigned error = 0;
4303
2
  char *key = 0, *str = 0;
4304
2
  unsigned i;
4305
2
4306
2
  while(!error) /*not really a while loop, only used to break on error*/
4307
2
  {
4308
2
    unsigned length, string2_begin;
4309
2
4310
2
    length = 0;
4311
24
    while(length < chunkLength && data[length] != 0) ++length;
4312
2
    /*even though it's not allowed by the standard, no error is thrown if
4313
2
    there's no null termination char, if the text is empty*/
4314
2
    if(length < 1 || length > 79) CERROR_BREAK(error, 89); /*keyword too short or long*/
4315
2
4316
2
    key = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4317
2
    if(!key) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4318
2
4319
2
    key[length] = 0;
4320
24
    for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) key[i] = (char)data[i];
4321
2
4322
2
    string2_begin = length + 1; /*skip keyword null terminator*/
4323
2
4324
2
    length = chunkLength < string2_begin ? 0 : chunkLength - string2_begin;
4325
2
    str = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4326
2
    if(!str) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4327
2
4328
2
    str[length] = 0;
4329
52
    for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) str[i] = (char)data[string2_begin + i];
4330
2
4331
2
    error = lodepng_add_text(info, key, str);
4332
2
4333
2
    break;
4334
2
  }
4335
2
4336
2
  lodepng_free(key);
4337
2
  lodepng_free(str);
4338
2
4339
2
  return error;
4340
2
}

/*international text chunk (iTXt)*/
4392
static unsigned readChunk_iTXt(LodePNGInfo* info, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* zlibsettings,
4393
                               const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength)
4394
1
{
4395
1
  unsigned error = 0;
4396
1
  unsigned i;
4397
1
4398
1
  unsigned length, begin, compressed;
4399
1
  char *key = 0, *langtag = 0, *transkey = 0;
4400
1
  ucvector decoded;
4401
1
  ucvector_init(&decoded);
4402
1
4403
1
  while(!error) /*not really a while loop, only used to break on error*/
4404
1
  {
4405
1
    /*Quick check if the chunk length isn't too small. Even without check
4406
1
    it'd still fail with other error checks below if it's too short. This just gives a different error code.*/
4407
1
    if(chunkLength < 5) CERROR_BREAK(error, 30); /*iTXt chunk too short*/
4408
1
4409
1
    /*read the key*/
4410
18
    for(length = 0; length < chunkLength && data[length] != 0; ++length) ;
4411
1
    if(length + 3 >= chunkLength) CERROR_BREAK(error, 75); /*no null termination char, corrupt?*/
4412
1
    if(length < 1 || length > 79) CERROR_BREAK(error, 89); /*keyword too short or long*/
4413
1
4414
1
    key = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4415
1
    if(!key) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4416
1
4417
1
    key[length] = 0;
4418
18
    for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) key[i] = (char)data[i];
4419
1
4420
1
    /*read the compression method*/
4421
1
    compressed = data[length + 1];
4422
1
    if(data[length + 2] != 0) CERROR_BREAK(error, 72); /*the 0 byte indicating compression must be 0*/
4423
1
4424
1
    /*even though it's not allowed by the standard, no error is thrown if
4425
1
    there's no null termination char, if the text is empty for the next 3 texts*/
4426
1
4427
1
    /*read the langtag*/
4428
1
    begin = length + 3;
4429
1
    length = 0;
4430
1
    for(i = begin; i < chunkLength && data[i] != 0; ++i) ++length;
4431
1
4432
1
    langtag = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4433
1
    if(!langtag) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4434
1
4435
1
    langtag[length] = 0;
4436
1
    for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) langtag[i] = (char)data[begin + i];
4437
1
4438
1
    /*read the transkey*/
4439
1
    begin += length + 1;
4440
1
    length = 0;
4441
1
    for(i = begin; i < chunkLength && data[i] != 0; ++i) ++length;
4442
1
4443
1
    transkey = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4444
1
    if(!transkey) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4445
1
4446
1
    transkey[length] = 0;
4447
1
    for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) transkey[i] = (char)data[begin + i];
4448
1
4449
1
    /*read the actual text*/
4450
1
    begin += length + 1;
4451
1
4452
1
    length = chunkLength < begin ? 0 : chunkLength - begin;
4453
1
4454
1
    if(compressed)
4455
0
    {
4456
0
      /*will fail if zlib error, e.g. if length is too small*/
4457
0
      error = zlib_decompress(&decoded.data, &decoded.size,
4458
0
                              (unsigned char*)(&data[begin]),
4459
0
                              length, zlibsettings);
4460
0
      if(error) break;
4461
0
      if(decoded.allocsize < decoded.size) decoded.allocsize = decoded.size;
4462
0
      ucvector_push_back(&decoded, 0);
4463
0
    }
4464
1
    else
4465
1
    {
4466
1
      if(!ucvector_resize(&decoded, length + 1)) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83 /*alloc fail*/);
4467
1
4468
1
      decoded.data[length] = 0;
4469
324
      for(i = 0; i != length; ++i) decoded.data[i] = data[begin + i];
4470
1
    }
4471
1
4472
1
    error = lodepng_add_itext(info, key, langtag, transkey, (char*)decoded.data);
4473
1
4474
1

4475
1
  }
4476
1
4477
1
  lodepng_free(key);
4478

4479

4480
1
  ucvector_cleanup(&decoded);
4481
1
4482
1
  return error;

4485
static unsigned readChunk_tIME(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength)
4486
1
{
4487
1
  if(chunkLength != 7) return 73; /*invalid tIME chunk size*/
4488
1
4489
1
  info->time_defined = 1;
4490
1
  info->time.year = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4491
1
  info->time.month = data[2];
4492
1
  info->time.day = data[3];
4493
1
  info->time.hour = data[4];
4494
1
  info->time.minute = data[5];
4495
1
  info->time.second = data[6];
4496
1
4497
1
  return 0; /* OK */
4498
1
}
4499
4500
static unsigned readChunk_pHYs(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength)
4501
1
{
4502
1
  if(chunkLength != 9) return 74; /*invalid pHYs chunk size*/
4503
1
4504
1
  info->phys_defined = 1;
4505
1
  info->phys_x = 16777216u * data[0] + 65536u * data[1] + 256u * data[2] + data[3];
4506
1
  info->phys_y = 16777216u * data[4] + 65536u * data[5] + 256u * data[6] + data[7];
4507
1
  info->phys_unit = data[8];
4508
1
4509
1
  return 0; /* OK */
4510
1
}
4511
#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/

4513
/*read a PNG, the result will be in the same color type as the PNG (hence "generic")*/
4514
static void decodeGeneric(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h,
4515
                          LodePNGState* state,
4516
                          const unsigned char* in, size_t insize)
4517
6
{
4518
6
  unsigned char IEND = 0;
4519
6
  const unsigned char* chunk;
4520
6
  size_t i;
4521
6
  ucvector idat; /*the data from idat chunks*/
4522
6
  ucvector scanlines;
4523
6
  size_t predict;
4524
6
  size_t numpixels;
4525
6
  size_t outsize = 0;
4526
6
4527
6
  /*for unknown chunk order*/
4528
6
  unsigned unknown = 0;
4529
6
#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4530
6
  unsigned critical_pos = 1; /*1 = after IHDR, 2 = after PLTE, 3 = after IDAT*/
4531
6
#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4532
6
4533
6
  /*provide some proper output values if error will happen*/
4534
6
  *out = 0;
4535
6
4536
6
  state->error = lodepng_inspect(w, h, state, in, insize); /*reads header and resets other parameters in state->info_png*/
4537
6
  if(state->error) return;
4538
6
4539
6
  numpixels = *w * *h;
4540
6
4541
6
  /*multiplication overflow*/
4542
6
  if(*h != 0 && numpixels / *h != *w) CERROR_RETURN(state->error, 92);
4543
6
  /*multiplication overflow possible further below. Allows up to 2^31-1 pixel
4544
6
  bytes with 16-bit RGBA, the rest is room for filter bytes.*/
4545
6
  if(numpixels > 268435455) CERROR_RETURN(state->error, 92);
4546
6
4547
6
  ucvector_init(&idat);
4548
6
  chunk = &in[33]; /*first byte of the first chunk after the header*/
4549
6
4550
6
  /*loop through the chunks, ignoring unknown chunks and stopping at IEND chunk.
4551
6
  IDAT data is put at the start of the in buffer*/
4552
65
  while(!IEND && !state->error)
4553
59
  {
4554
59
    unsigned chunkLength;
4555
59
    const unsigned char* data; /*the data in the chunk*/
4556
59
4557
59
    /*error: size of the in buffer too small to contain next chunk*/
4558
59
    if((size_t)((chunk - in) + 12) > insize || chunk < in) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 30);
4559
59
4560
59
    /*length of the data of the chunk, excluding the length bytes, chunk type and CRC bytes*/
4561
59
    chunkLength = lodepng_chunk_length(chunk);
4562
59
    /*error: chunk length larger than the max PNG chunk size*/
4563
59
    if(chunkLength > 2147483647) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 63);
4564
59
4565
59
    if((size_t)((chunk - in) + chunkLength + 12) > insize || (chunk + chunkLength + 12) < in)
4566
0
    {
4567
0
      CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 64); /*error: size of the in buffer too small to contain next chunk*/
4568
0
    }
4569
59
4570
59
    data = lodepng_chunk_data_const(chunk);
4571
59
4572
59
    /*IDAT chunk, containing compressed image data*/
4573
59
    if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "IDAT"))
4574
40
    {
4575
40
      size_t oldsize = idat.size;
4576
40
      if(!ucvector_resize(&idat, oldsize + chunkLength)) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 83 /*alloc fail*/);
4577
1.12M
      for(i = 0; i != chunkLength; ++i) idat.data[oldsize + i] = data[i];
4578
40
#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4579
40
      critical_pos = 3;
4580
40
#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4581
40
    }
4582
19
    /*IEND chunk*/
4583
19
    else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "IEND"))
4584
6
    {
4585
6
      IEND = 1;
4586
6
    }
4587
13
    /*palette chunk (PLTE)*/
4588
13
    else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "PLTE"))
4589
4
    {
4590
4
      state->error = readChunk_PLTE(&state->info_png.color, data, chunkLength);

4
      if(state->error) break;

4603

4604

4627

    else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "iTXt"))

    }
4641
4
    else if(lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "pHYs"))
4642

      if(state->error) break;
4645

    }
4646
3
#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4647
3
    else /*it's not an implemented chunk type, so ignore it: skip over the data*/
4648
3
    {
4649
3
      /*error: unknown critical chunk (5th bit of first byte of chunk type is 0)*/
4650
3
      if(!lodepng_chunk_ancillary(chunk)) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 69);
4651
3
4652
3
      unknown = 1;
4653
3
#ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4654
3
      if(state->decoder.remember_unknown_chunks)

0
      {
4656
0

4658

        if(state->error) break;

      }
4660

#endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4661
3
    }
4662
59
4663
59
    if(!state->decoder.ignore_crc && !unknown) /*check CRC if wanted, only on known chunk types*/
4664
12
    {
4665
12
      if(lodepng_chunk_check_crc(chunk)) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 57); /*invalid CRC*/
4666
12
    }
4667
59
4668
59
    if(!IEND) chunk = lodepng_chunk_next_const(chunk);
4669
59
  }
4670
6
4671
6
  ucvector_init(&scanlines);
4672
6
  /*predict output size, to allocate exact size for output buffer to avoid more dynamic allocation.
4673
6
  If the decompressed size does not match the prediction, the image must be corrupt.*/
4674
6
  if(state->info_png.interlace_method == 0)
4675
6
  {
4676
6
    /*The extra *h is added because this are the filter bytes every scanline starts with*/
4677
6
    predict = lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(*w, *h, &state->info_png.color) + *h;
4678
6
  }
4679
0
  else
4680
0
  {
4681
0
    /*Adam-7 interlaced: predicted size is the sum of the 7 sub-images sizes*/
4682
0
    const LodePNGColorMode* color = &state->info_png.color;
4683
0
    predict = 0;
4684
0
    predict += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 7) >> 3, (*h + 7) >> 3, color) + ((*h + 7) >> 3);
4685
0
    if(*w > 4) predict += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 3) >> 3, (*h + 7) >> 3, color) + ((*h + 7) >> 3);
4686
0
    predict += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 3) >> 2, (*h + 3) >> 3, color) + ((*h + 3) >> 3);
4687
0
    if(*w > 2) predict += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 1) >> 2, (*h + 3) >> 2, color) + ((*h + 3) >> 2);
4688
0
    predict += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 1) >> 1, (*h + 1) >> 2, color) + ((*h + 1) >> 2);
4689
0
    if(*w > 1) predict += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 0) >> 1, (*h + 1) >> 1, color) + ((*h + 1) >> 1);
4690
0
    predict += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 0), (*h + 0) >> 1, color) + ((*h + 0) >> 1);
4691
0
  }
4692
6
  if(!state->error && !ucvector_reserve(&scanlines, predict)) state->error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
4693
6
  if(!state->error)
4694
6
  {
4695
6
    state->error = zlib_decompress(&scanlines.data, &scanlines.size, idat.data,
4696
6
                                   idat.size, &state->decoder.zlibsettings);
4697
6
    if(!state->error && scanlines.size != predict) state->error = 91; /*decompressed size doesn't match prediction*/
4698
6
  }
4699
6
  ucvector_cleanup(&idat);
4700
6
4701
6
  if(!state->error)
4702
6
  {
4703
6
    outsize = lodepng_get_raw_size(*w, *h, &state->info_png.color);
4704
6
    *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(outsize);
4705
6
    if(!*out) state->error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
4706
6
  }
4707
6
  if(!state->error)
4708
6
  {
4709
2.02M
    for(i = 0; i < outsize; i++) (*out)[i] = 0;
4710
6
    state->error = postProcessScanlines(*out, scanlines.data, *w, *h, &state->info_png);
4711
6
  }
4712
6
  ucvector_cleanup(&scanlines);
4713
6
}
4714
4715
unsigned lodepng_decode(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h,
4716
                        LodePNGState* state,
4717
                        const unsigned char* in, size_t insize)
4718
6
{
4719
6
  *out = 0;
4720
6
  decodeGeneric(out, w, h, state, in, insize);
4721
6
  if(state->error) return state->error;
4722
6
  if(!state->decoder.color_convert || lodepng_color_mode_equal(&state->info_raw, &state->info_png.color))
4723
1
  {
4724
1
    /*same color type, no copying or converting of data needed*/
4725
1
    /*store the info_png color settings on the info_raw so that the info_raw still reflects what colortype
4726
1
    the raw image has to the end user*/
4727
1
    if(!state->decoder.color_convert)
4728
0
    {
4729
0
      state->error = lodepng_color_mode_copy(&state->info_raw, &state->info_png.color);
4730
0
      if(state->error) return state->error;
4731
5
    }
4732
5
  }
4733
5
  else
4734
5
  {
4735
5
    /*color conversion needed; sort of copy of the data*/
4736
5
    unsigned char* data = *out;
4737
5
    size_t outsize;
4738
5
4739
5
    /*TODO: check if this works according to the statement in the documentation: "The converter can convert
4740
5
    from greyscale input color type, to 8-bit greyscale or greyscale with alpha"*/
4741
5
    if(!(state->info_raw.colortype == LCT_RGB || state->info_raw.colortype == LCT_RGBA)
4742
5
       && !(state->info_raw.bitdepth == 8))
4743
0
    {
4744
0
      return 56; /*unsupported color mode conversion*/
4745
0
    }
4746
5
4747
5
    outsize = lodepng_get_raw_size(*w, *h, &state->info_raw);
4748
5
    *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(outsize);
4749
5
    if(!(*out))
4750
0
    {
4751
0
      state->error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
4752
0
    }
4753
5
    else state->error = lodepng_convert(*out, data, &state->info_raw,
4754
5
                                        &state->info_png.color, *w, *h);
4755
5
    lodepng_free(data);
4756
5
  }
4757
6
  return state->error;
4758
6
}

unsigned lodepng_decode_memory(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const unsigned char* in,
4761
                               size_t insize, LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth)
4762
6
{
4763
6

4764
6

4765
6
  lodepng_state_init(&state);
4766
6

4767
6
  state.info_raw.bitdepth = bitdepth;
4768
6
  error = lodepng_decode(out, w, h, &state, in, insize);
4769
6
  lodepng_state_cleanup(&state);
4770
6
  return error;
4771
6
}

/*chunkName must be string of 4 characters*/
4860
static unsigned addChunk(ucvector* out, const char* chunkName, const unsigned char* data, size_t length)
4861
8
{
4862
8
  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_create(&out->data, &out->size, (unsigned)length, chunkName, data));
4863
8
  out->allocsize = out->size; /*fix the allocsize again*/
4864
8
  return 0;
4865
8
}

static void writeSignature(ucvector* out)
4868
2
{
4869
2
  /*8 bytes PNG signature, aka the magic bytes*/
4870
2
  ucvector_push_back(out, 137);
4871
2
  ucvector_push_back(out, 80);
4872
2
  ucvector_push_back(out, 78);
4873
2
  ucvector_push_back(out, 71);
4874
2
  ucvector_push_back(out, 13);
4875
2
  ucvector_push_back(out, 10);
4876
2
  ucvector_push_back(out, 26);
4877
2
  ucvector_push_back(out, 10);
4878
2
}

static unsigned addChunk_IHDR(ucvector* out, unsigned w, unsigned h,
4881
                              LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth, unsigned interlace_method)
4882
2
{
4883
2
  unsigned error = 0;
4884
2
  ucvector header;
4885
2
  ucvector_init(&header);
4886
2
4887
2
  lodepng_add32bitInt(&header, w); /*width*/
4888
2
  lodepng_add32bitInt(&header, h); /*height*/
4889
2
  ucvector_push_back(&header, (unsigned char)bitdepth); /*bit depth*/
4890
2
  ucvector_push_back(&header, (unsigned char)colortype); /*color type*/
4891
2
  ucvector_push_back(&header, 0); /*compression method*/
4892
2
  ucvector_push_back(&header, 0); /*filter method*/
4893
2
  ucvector_push_back(&header, interlace_method); /*interlace method*/
4894
2
4895
2
  error = addChunk(out, "IHDR", header.data, header.size);
4896
2
  ucvector_cleanup(&header);
4897
2
4898
2
  return error;
4899
2
}

4907
18

4908
16

4909
16

4910
16

16

static unsigned addChunk_tRNS(ucvector* out, const LodePNGColorMode* info)
4919
0

4920
0
  unsigned error = 0;
4921
0

4922
0

4923
0
  ucvector_init(&tRNS);
4924
0
  if(info->colortype == LCT_PALETTE)
4925
0
  {
4926
0
    size_t amount = info->palettesize;
4927
0
    /*the tail of palette values that all have 255 as alpha, does not have to be encoded*/
4928
0
    for(i = info->palettesize; i != 0; --i)
4929
0
    {
4930
0
      if(info->palette[4 * (i - 1) + 3] == 255) --amount;
4931
0
      else break;
4932
0
    }
4933
0
    /*add only alpha channel*/
4934
0
    for(i = 0; i != amount; ++i) ucvector_push_back(&tRNS, info->palette[4 * i + 3]);
4935
0
  }
4936
0
  else if(info->colortype == LCT_GREY)
4937
0
  {
4938
0
    if(info->key_defined)
4939
0
    {
4940
0
      ucvector_push_back(&tRNS, (unsigned char)(info->key_r >> 8));
4941
0
      ucvector_push_back(&tRNS, (unsigned char)(info->key_r & 255));
4942
0
    }
4943
0
  }
4944
0

4945
0
  {
4946
0

4947
0
    {
4948
0
      ucvector_push_back(&tRNS, (unsigned char)(info->key_r >> 8));
4949
0
      ucvector_push_back(&tRNS, (unsigned char)(info->key_r & 255));
4950
0

0

0
